intro: Periploca pallida, commonly known as the white periploca, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Periploca pallida is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
